author: Julia Sayers | jsayers@al.com
title: 7 local drinks to get you in the mood for fall
text:
As the weather transitions from warm to cool, these seven autumnal drinks will take you from summer to fall with refreshing cocktails, hot coffees, and energizing teas.
O'HENRY'S PUMPKIN SPICE LATTE If you're in the mood for a Pumpkin Spice Latte, support your local business by getting one at O'Henry's. They make their latte with half-and-half, which gives it a creamier texture. You can also get the Hot Spiced Apple Cider and Cinnamon Maple Spice Latte on the fall menu.
O'Henry's Coffees | various locations | ohenryscoffees.com
BURT REYNOLDS FROM FLIP BURGER Flip Burger at The Summit has a great craft cocktails list, and the Burt Reynolds is an autumnal whiskey drink. With Jim Beam, orange, lemon, and agave nectar, it's perfect to sip on during gameday.
Flip Burger Boutique | 220 Summit Blvd, Suite 140 | 205.968.2000 | flipburgerboutique.com
THE RED CAT PUMPKIN PRALINE LATTE The Red Cat Coffee House is a great place to cozy up with a warm coffee, and this fall they'll be offering a Pumpkin Praline Latte. It even comes with a Tin Roof praline made in Brookhaven, Mississippi.
The Red Cat | 2901 2nd Ave S. | 205.616.8450 | theredcatcoffeehouse.com
FALL TEAS FROM PIPER & LEAF At Pepper Place Market on Saturdays, you'll see almost everyone carrying around large Mason jars of iced tea from Piper & Leaf. If you visit this fall, you can try their fall flavors of Pumpkin Moonshine and Caramel Apple Pie, served hot or iced. The teas are also available at Continental Bakery, The Abbey coffee shop, and Primeaux Wine and Cheese.
Piper & Leaf at Pepper Place Market | 2829 2nd Ave S. | 256.929.9404 | piperandleaf.com
BIRMINGHAM BUZZ'D FROM THE COLLINS BAR Collins is known for their handcrafted specialty cocktails. They don't have a cocktail menu, so they'll whip up whatever you feel like, but bartender Josh Schaff created a special fall cocktail just for Birmingham Magazine. Ask for the Birmingham Buzz'd featuring tequila, lime, grapefruit, grenadine, and Strega. With the weather fluctuations in Alabama's fall, Josh created the perfect cocktail to take you from summer into fall.
Collins Bar | 2125 2nd Ave N. | 205.323.7995 | thecollinsbar.com
NORMANDY KICK FROM HIGHLANDS Due in part to a fairly warm fall in Alabama, Highlands has created a menu of refreshing fall cocktails. Our favorite is the Normandy Kick with an apple brandy from Normandy, and Cardamaro, a digestif from Italy that adds the "kick." Sample the other fall cocktail options, as well: Gentian and Ginger, Havana Crossroad, and the Andalusian.
Highlands Bar and Grill | 2011 11th Ave S. | 205.939.1400 | highlandsbarandgrill.com
EIGHT SWORD SWIZZLE FROM CARRIGAN'S This cocktail from Carrigan's is refreshing while tying in fall flavors. With a coconut-infused sake base, the tropical notes of the sake are combined with baking spices, heather, citrus, and honey. The cocktail is reminiscent of a warm fall day turning into a cooler evening. It's stirred with a swizzle stick until it's chilled enough to frost the glass.
Carrigan's Public House | 2430 Morris Ave. | 205.440.2430 | carriganspub.com
